sections.purpose: To study drug effects on isolated tissues in vitro.
sections.scope: Applicable to smooth muscle and tissue pharmacology.
procedure: Fill the organ bath with appropriate physiological solution and maintain at 37Â°C.
Bubble the solution with a gas mixture (e.g., carbogen).
Mount the isolated tissue between the hook and force transducer.
Apply initial resting tension and allow equilibration with regular washing.
Administer drugs in cumulative or non-cumulative manner as per protocol.
Record tissue responses and wash between doses.
At the end, discard tissue and clean the bath thoroughly.
precautions: Maintain constant temperature and pH of the bath.
Prevent air bubbles from contacting the tissue.
Handle sharps and biological waste as per SOP.
